IX.iii.1.G.3.g
.
ADL and IADL
ADLs are basic self-care activities, consisting of
bathing or showering
dressing
eating
getting in or out of bed or a chair (transferring)
toileting, and
ambulating within the home or living area.
ADLs do
not
include instrumental ADLs (IADLs).  IADLs are activities other than basic self-care that are needed for independent living.  Examples of IADL include
shopping
food preparation
housekeeping
laundering
handling medication
managing finances
using the telephone, and
transportation for non-medical purposes.
Note
:  Pull cords, 24-hour staffing, and locked exterior doors are
not
considered either ADL or IADL, although they may be indicative of a protected environment.
